Our History

History of Level Up College

Level Up College was founded in 2012 by a team of inspired youth from Kayah/Karenni State under the guidance of Bishop Sotero Phamo. The college was established through the partnership with the Myanmar Community Academies Program (MCAP) under the Thabyay Foundation, with the recommendation and support of the Youth Life Formation Center (YLFC) and collaborative efforts from various community leaders
Initially, Level Up College was launched as an extension program of YLFC in Loikaw and was named YLFC-Level Up Program. In 2013, it was officially registered as Level Up Academy with the Township Education Ministry Office.
Level Up College is dedicated to supporting youth from diverse backgrounds by equipping them with the skills and knowledge needed to create a lasting, positive impact in their communities. The college offers a Diploma in Social and Development Studies, originally designed to provide educational opportunities for:
  • ◉ Youth who have completed high school but have limited access to higher education.
  • ◉ University graduates who are unprepared for available job opportunities.
  • ◉ Students from conflict-affected areas who have lost access to higher education due to gaps in the formal educational pathway.
Over time, the college has continued to address the growing demand for quality higher education in the region, especially as more students face challenges caused by the global pandemic and national crises since 2020.
The institution began with an 18-month Certificate Program in Intensive Community Development and Leadership, which was later upgraded to the two year Diploma Program. Additionally, the college has initiated various other programs, including:Bridging Program, Youth Skills and Community Engagement Program, Oasis Program, Career Pathway Program, University Preparation Program (UP Program) and Summer English Program. Despite national instability and crises, the college has relocated multiple times but has remained steadfast in its commitment to serving youth. Guided by its strategic vision, Level Up College is preparing to offer a degree program in the near future.
As of December 2024, Level Up College has conducted nine commencement ceremonies and has built a strong alumni network, with graduates actively working in the development sector. The college continues to stand as a community-based higher education institution, committed to training local youth as agents of positive change in their communities.
Level Up College is a key member of Myanmar Colleges Consortium(MCC) which is a cohesive, high-quality educational network that empowers institutions and enhances academic excellence across Myanmar.

Level Up College

Level Up College is a community-based, non-profit higher education institution empowering youth from diverse backgrounds, especially those from marginalized communities and conflict-affected areas in Kayah (Karenni) State and the nearby region..
